intro: Edwardsia chilensis var. meiantha, commonly known as the Chilean velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in coastal regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
